## Repository Information

**Repository:** prakashsellathurai/Awesome-Product-Management
**URL:** https://github.com/prakashsellathurai/Awesome-Product-Management
**Category/Focus:** Broad PM resource list, receptive to practical PM guides and tools

## Submission Details

### Target Audience
Product Managers looking for practical frameworks, templates, and tools to improve their PM practice. This list attracts PMs seeking to level up their skills and process.

### Positioning/Pitch
PM-Skills brings AI-powered efficiency to PM workflows. Instead of just reading about frameworks, PMs can instantly generate professional artifacts using proven templates and methodologies.

### Relevant Section
Likely fits in sections like:
- "Tools" or "Software Tools"
- "Templates & Frameworks"
- "AI Tools for PMs" (if exists, or suggest creating)
- "Resources" or "Guides"

### Submission Content

**Title/Name:**
```
PM-Skills - AI-Powered PM Workflow Framework
```

**Description:**
```markdown
24 production-ready PM skills for AI assistants (Claude, GitHub Copilot, Cursor). Generate professional PRDs, user stories, hypotheses, experiment designs, retrospectives, and more using battle-tested frameworks (Triple Diamond, JTBD, Opportunity Solution Trees). Includes workflow bundles for Feature Kickoff and Lean Startup. Open source (Apache 2.0).
```

**Link:**
```
https://github.com/product-on-purpose/pm-skills
```

**Alternative shorter description:**
```markdown
AI-powered PM workflows: 24 skills for generating PRDs, user stories, experiments, and retrospectives with professional templates and frameworks.
```

## Notes

This is a high-value submission - PMs browsing this list are exactly the target audience. Emphasize:

1. **Practical utility:** Not just theory - instantly usable workflows
2. **AI integration:** Modern PM practice with AI assistants
3. **Framework-based:** Built on proven PM methodologies (Triple Diamond, JTBD, OST)
4. **Professional quality:** Templates and examples from real product work
5. **Open source:** Free for commercial use

Frame as "AI-enhanced PM practice" rather than "AI tool" - it's about making PMs more effective, not replacing them.
